page.title: 02HISTORY
page.content: The {origins} of{Lanark}go back to the Early Middle Ages.The town developed around an earthwork {castle}at the bottom of the Castlegate.This part of the town dates back to the reign of David 1 (1135-1153).During the late Middle Ages the town expanded to include the High Street. There are two possible {origins}for the name{Lanark, either fortress on a promentary or the place of the woolworkers. From the earliest times {Lanark} was an important agricultural centre as it still is today.The main places of historical interest in the {Lanark} area are {New Lanark}famous for its connections with Robert Owen,the ruined church of St Kentigern's because of William Wallace and the Clydesdale Hotel as it was visited by William Wordsworth and Samuel Taylor Coleridge.
